R.I.P RSC:

I might even sell my e-reader, I think I prefer real books.

item.title: Book Collection Thread
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I’m thinking of buying a few new books, I’m amazed how cheap they are. They’re all paperback, and copyright free, which probably explains it.

Utopia 3,99
The Republic 4,99
Sonnets 2,99
On the social contract 3,99
War and Peace 3,99
Crime and punishment 3,99
On dreams 4,99
Sorrows Of Young Werther 4,99
On Liberty 4,99

9 Books, €38,91 for all! War and Peace alone is >1000 pages of (supposedly) awesomeness. Probably printed on toilet paper, but I don’t care.

I might even sell my e-reader, I think I prefer real books. Apparently, the one I have (Sony prs-650) is hard to get at the moment, and sells for more than I bought for on ebay.

Read full topic

item.title: Book Collection Thread
item.dc:creator: @SETO SETO
item.description:
@SETO wrote:

i have all the robert munch collections, 7 Calculus books, 3 vector calculus, 4 complete physics collections, 2 electromag, 3 C++ books, 1 C book, 2 Python books, 1 Java.

1 Complex math
2 signals
3 circuit analysis, 1 electronics sedra/smith
2 dynamics and 1 mechanics, 2 linear algebra

thats all i can think off my head, btw i refuse to have any literature book, expect rober munch cause they rock
